snippet: Nets officials worked furiously to land Dwight Howard, but they never could provide Orlando with a satisfactory package of players, draft picks and payroll relief.
abstract: Brooklyn Nets officials worked furiously to land Dwight Howard, but they never could provide the Orlando Magic with a satisfactory package of players, draft picks and payroll relief; team instead re-signs center Brook Lopez to a four-year, $60.8 million deal, a move that virtually eliminates any chance of acquiring Howard until 2013, assuming he is still available.
lead_paragraph: Nets officials worked furiously to land Dwight Howard, but they never could provide Orlando with a satisfactory package of players, draft picks and payroll relief.

headline.seo: Nets Balancing Lopez Future With Pursuit of Howard
headline.main: Unable to Make It Work, Nets Halt Bid for Howard
headline.print_headline: Unable to Make It Work, Nets Halt Bid for Howard
